Sentencas: Conventional SOFCs use Nickel Yttria-doped Zirconia cermet anodes, which are susceptible to degradation due to coking when operating with carbon containing fuels.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Raman spectroscopy is a powerful tool for investigating surface chemistry and, when combined with electrochemical impedance spectroscopy under in situ conditions, the technique can report the real-time material composition of the electrode during the EIS measurements.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Studies described in this work used in situ Raman spectroscopy and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy to examine the carbon tolerance of novel ceramic anode materials comprised of niobium doped strontium titanate infiltrated with nickel or cobalt nanoparticles.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: The susceptibility of these electrodes to coking were tested with CO/CO2 mixtures and pure methane at 850 degrees C. Data show that nickel-infiltrated STN electrodes are still prone to coking from methane.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: In contrast to STN electrodes infiltrated with nickel, cobalt-infiltrated STN electrodes showed no susceptibility to carbon deposition during methane exposure within the detection limit of the Raman measurements.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Neither anode showed evidence of coking from the CO/CO2 mixtures.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Coking correlated closely with changes in EIS measurements, with the most noticeable effects appearing in the low frequency part of the spectrum.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Ex situ SEM analysis of samples before and after operation illustrates the growth of the nanoparticles.
Titulo: Testing Novel Nickel and Cobalt Infiltrated STN Anodes for Carbon Tolerance using In Situ Raman Spectroscopy and Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy
